Articles.Content:
I'm trying to move some posts into a new thread, but the forum keeps merging all of my replies into one large post.  WHICH I DO NOT WANT.  I want all of the individual posts to remain individual.

What do I need to do to keep this from happening?  Why is the forum auto-merging replies?

Wait like 10 minutes between replies.

You may be able to get someone to reply after you over and over, and then later delete their replies too. I've never tried it but it seems like it'd work.

2 hours ago, Scarecrow71 said:

I'm trying to move some posts into a new thread, but the forum keeps merging all of my replies into one large post.  WHICH I DO NOT WANT.  I want all of the individual posts to remain individual.

If you want posts split into a new thread, let a member of the moderation team know what posts you want moved to a new thread. You can do this by either PMing a moderator or by reaching out through reporting your post you want to split off. You could also just copy and paste it into  a new header post or original post of a new thread, too.

2 hours ago, Scarecrow71 said:

but the forum keeps merging all of my replies into one large post. 

What do I need to do to keep this from happening?  Why is the forum auto-merging replies?

This is a setting within the forum software we have no control over. I believe @Superfluous J is correct - it is somewhere between ten to twenty minutes before it treats it as separate posts.
